intro: Erigeron calcicola, commonly known as the California fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. This plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron calcicola is well adapted to arid environments and is considered a valuable plant for ecological restoration projects.
